intro: Dasynema salicifolium, commonly known as the willow-leaf stromboid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its fern-like, compound leaves that resemble those of willow trees. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
